Posts.Content: SusanSnowFlake wrote: I have lymphedema.  I'm really mad.... stage one, only one lymph node removed, a tumor the size of a pencil eraser.  I'm not sure I can live with this.  So my cancer's gone, but my life is ruined.  My life was saved at the cost of living my life? Wonder how that works out statistically. I know that I will get over my sadness, I'm a strong woman, but I need time. Right now I'm angry that every time I go to the Doc or the therapist I'm expected to smile at every single person I encounter.  I don't feel like smiling why don't they understand that? Dx 4/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/2/2014 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Radiation Therapy 3DCRT: Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I wish someone could explain why I have to smile about this SusanSnowFlake sandcastle
